sub_topic: Finding the area of triangles using trigonometry
message_1: A right triangle has a base of 10 cm and a height of 14 cm. Find its area using trigonometry.
message_2:
To find the area of a right triangle using trigonometry, we can use the formula:

Area = (1/2) * base * height

We are given the base (10 cm) and the height (14 cm) of the right triangle. So, we can plug these values into the formula:

Area = (1/2) * 10 cm * 14 cm

Area = 5 cm * 14 cm

Area = 70 cmÂ²

The area of the right triangle is 70 square centimeters.
